title: Kenya’s election wrestling match: Dynasties v Hustlers
description: As the president backs his ex-rival in elections, his deputy says he is fighting dynastic rule.

title: Raksha Bandhan to Laal Singh Chaddha: 'Struggling' Bollywood's online hate problem
description: Stars like Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar have been facing incessant trolling, but does it affect their films?

title: Partition: My journey to the ‘place no-one spoke of’
description: Sparsh's family fled in terror 75 years ago - it wasn't spoken about until his grandfather agreed to talk.

title: Week in pictures: 30 July - 5 August 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Uganda: I was forced to leave idyllic childhood home
description: Nisha Popat looks back 50 years to when dictator Idi Amin forced her family out of Uganda

title: Mariupolchanka FC: The women's football team under siege in Ukraine
description: As England celebrate their Euros win, the women of Mariupol FC in Ukraine simply dream of playing again.

title: Alex Jones: Five revealing moments from Sandy Hook trial
description: Jones' claims about Sandy Hook, bankruptcy, dietary supplements and the jury were laid bare in the trial.

title: Commonwealth Games: England reach hockey final after New Zealand shootout
description: England's women reach the hockey final at the Commonwealth Games with a thrilling semi-final shootout win against defending champions New Zealand.

title: Commonwealth Games: George Miller becomes oldest medallist as Scotland win bowls gold
description: George Miller, 75, becomes the oldest Commonwealth Games gold medallist as Scotland defeat Wales in the final of the B2/B3 mixed pairs bowls.

title: Protesters interrupt Liz Truss speech
description: The foreign secretary can be heard responding with a promise to clamp down on disruptive protest.

title: Bollywood musical DDLJ accused of 'whitewashing'
description: Fans of the popular film are angry the character of Raj is being reimagined as a white man called Rog.

title: Commonwealth Games: Northern Ireland secure record medal haul of 16
description: Northern Ireland secure their best-ever medal haul at a Commonwealth Games as the men's fours win their lawn bowls semi-final.

title: Commonwealth Games: Marfa Ekimova takes rhythmic gymnastics gold for England
description: Marfa Ekimova makes history for England by winning their first ever gold medal in the rhythmic gymnastics individual all-around final at the Commonwealth Games, scoring 112.300 overall.

title: In pictures: England's bare lawns and parched parks
description: As hosepipe bans begin in some areas, images show dried-out lawns and parks across the country.

title: 'Bring me his head' - the spy sent to get Bin Laden
description: Gary Schroen, one of the first Americans on the ground in Afghanistan after 9/11, has died aged 80.

title: Bank's recession warning matters to everyone
description: Times are already hard but the Bank of England says they'll get worse and stay that way until late 2023

title: Scottish island of Pladda on sale for price of a city flat
description: Pladda off the coast of Arran is on sale for £350,000 and includes a five-bed house and helipad.

title: Tory leadership: Do Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak's tax pledges add up?
description: The two contenders promise tax cuts but have given little detail about how to pay for them.

title: How will a recession hit the UK housing market?
description: The UK economy is forecast to shrink this year but what will it mean for first-time home buyers?

title: Tory leadership: I took money out of deprived urban areas says Sunak
description: Allies of the former chancellor say he changed outdated rules to reflect need in rural areas.

title: Jack Woodley: Teens sentenced for gang attack murder
description: Ten teenagers are being sentenced for the murder of 18-year-old Jack Woodley.

title: Commonwealth Games: Watch brilliant badminton doubles rally
description: Watch as Canada doubles pair Adam Dong and Nyl Yakura are left on the ground after a brilliant rally against England's Ben Lane and Sean Vendy at the Commonwealth Games.

title: Has Brexit squashed our edible insect industry?
description: Businesses wanting to sell bugs as food in the UK were left in limbo due to post-Brexit confusion.

title: Marc Cucurella: Chelsea sign Brighton defender for £60m
description: Spain left-back Marc Cucurella joins Chelsea in a deal worth more than £60m after only one season at Brighton.

title: Covid infections continuing to fall around the UK
description: The number of people with the virus has fallen by more than half a million in a week, statistics show.

title: Mont Blanc climbers to pay €15,000 rescue deposit
description: Climbers should pay a huge deposit for rescue and funeral costs to attempt Mont Blanc, a mayor says.

title: Archie Battersbee: Family refused permission for hospice move
description: The 12-year-old's mother says "all our wishes as a family have been denied by the authorities".

title: Covid-19: North Korea claims to have recovered from outbreak
description: There is widespread scepticism over North Korea's claim to have the world's lowest Covid death rate.

title: Sky Sports commentator apologises over Hillsborough remarks
description: Martin Tyler says he did not intend to link the Hillsborough disaster to hooliganism in a BBC interview.

title: Commonwealth Games: Jack Laugher and Anthony Harding win synchronised 3m springboard gold
description: England diving pair Jack Laugher and Anthony Harding win synchronised 3m springboard gold at the Commonwealth Games.

title: Clampdown on social media ads for risky hay-fever jab
description: The steroid injection is available on prescription for some treatments but not hay fever.

title: Depression myths: 'Stopping medication made me twice as bad'
description: What's like for people taking medication to read stories that suggest anti-depressants don't work?

title: China-Taiwan: Joseph Wu defends US Speaker Pelosi's visit
description: Joseph Wu tells the BBC he will continue inviting leaders to Taipei, as China sanctions Nancy Pelosi.

title: Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak row over recession warning in latest TV clash
description: Liz Truss says a recession can be averted, while Rishi Sunak argues tax cuts would fuel inflation

title: World Sports Photography Awards 2022 winners revealed
description: A picture of a butterfly on the fingertips of tennis player Naomi Osaka is named overall winner.

title: Birmingham Bull saved from scrap-heap
description: The mechanical bull used in the Commonwealth opening ceremony will now be given a permanent home in the city.

title: TfL junk food advert ban: Has the policy cut obesity?
description: A new study claims 100,000 obesity cases have been prevented due to a ban on junk food advertising.

title: Bank of England governor defends rate hike ahead of looming recession
description: Bank of England governor Andrew Bailey warns price rises would be long-term if Bank did not act.

title: Ukraine war: Russia undermining safety of Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant - UK
description: The UK defence ministry says Russian troops are likely operating in the areas around the plant.

title: Premier League predictions for opening weekend
description: Chris Sutton is BBC Sport's new predictions expert and he has picked his winners and losers for the opening weekend of the Premier League season.

title: Ben Stokes' schedule warning heard, says ECB chief executive Clare Connor
description: Ben Stokes' warning over the schedule demands on top players has "absolutely" been heard, says interim England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive Clare Connor.

title: I forgive the man who tried to murder me
description: A killer on home release left Linda McDonald for dead - now she says the parole system must change.

title: Why is a wet country like Scotland facing water scarcity?
description: The Scottish Environment Protection Agency has issued a series of water scarcity warnings in 2022.

title: Growth in NHS recruits from abroad prompts concern about over-reliance
description: BBC research shows one-in-three new doctors in England last year came from outside the UK and EU.

title: Afghanistan refugees: Hotels and hopelessness, but opportunity too, in UK
description: One year on from the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan, we talk to some of the people who escaped to the UK.

title: Did we all believe a myth about depression?
description: A study some claim debunks antidepressants has gone viral. Was it read wrong?
